result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyquice L. Citchen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyquice L. Citchen

records.addlTxt: 9:33 AM Defendant Tyquice L. Citchen in court.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson in court for Tyquice L. Citchen.  Attorney David S Olson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty; Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders sentence withheld, 12 months probation, costs due to Clerk of Court, 11 days sentence credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
